meanings.definition: A contrasting or complementary musical theme or melody.
meanings.sent1: In the song, the violin played a beautiful counterpoint to the piano.
meanings.sent2: The choir sang in perfect counterpoint, creating a harmonious blend of voices.
meanings.sent3: The flute's counterpoint to the drums added a unique twist to the music.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a joyful counterpoint to the seriousness of the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The guitar solo served as a brilliant counterpoint to the main melody.

meanings.definition: A contrasting element or idea that emphasizes differences.
meanings.sent1: The artist used light and shadow as a counterpoint in the painting.
meanings.sent2: The character's optimism was a refreshing counterpoint to the gloomy atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: His love for spicy food was a funny counterpoint to her dislike of anything hot.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the room was a stark counterpoint to the noisy street outside.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors of the flowers provided a vivid counterpoint to the dull walls.

meanings.sent1: She decided to counterpoint the bold flavors with a hint of sweetness.
meanings.sent2: The artist chose to counterpoint the dark background with a pop of color.
meanings.sent3: His casual attire counterpointed the formal dress code of the event.
meanings.sent4: The spicy salsa counterpoints the mild flavor of the dish perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The soft vocals counterpointed the energetic beat of the music.
